issue.title: Splitwise Clone v2
issue.body:
## Build expense-sharing app

A web app where friends track shared expenses and settle debts.

**Features:**
- Google OAuth + email/password login  
- Create expense groups, invite members
- Add expenses (split equally among members)
- Real-time balance calculations
- Settle up functionality
- Live updates with Socket.io

**Tech Stack:**
- Next.js 14 App Router
- Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui
- Lucide React icons
- SQLite with better-sqlite3
- NextAuth.js
- Socket.io

**Design:**
- Clean, minimal - not generic AI look
- Mobile-first responsive
- Use shadcn/ui components

**Pages:**
- Landing page
- Login/Signup
- Dashboard (list groups, balances)
- Group detail (expenses, members, balances)
- Create group dialog

ems.task: Initialize Next.js 14 project with App Router, configure TypeScript, create .gitignore for Next.js, set up package.json with all dependencies (next-auth, better-sqlite3, socket.io, shadcn/ui, tailwindcss), configure tsconfig.json with strict mode, and set up Tailwind CSS configuration
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Design and implement SQLite database schema with better-sqlite3, including tables for users, groups, group_members, expenses, expense_splits, and settlements. Create database initialization and connection utilities. Implement all database access layer functions for CRUD operations

workers.task: Create database schema, connection utilities, and initialization. Define all SQLite table creation queries for users, groups, group_members, expenses, expense_splits, and settlements tables
Implement all CRUD operations for users, groups, and group_members tables. Create functions for user creation/retrieval, group management, and group membership operations
Implement all CRUD operations for expenses, expense_splits, and settlements tables. Create functions for expense tracking, split calculations, and settlement management

ems.task: Configure NextAuth.js for authentication with both Google OAuth provider and email/password credentials. Implement session management, API routes for login/signup/logout, and protected route middleware. Create user registration and profile management

workers.task: Create NextAuth.js configuration with Google OAuth and Credentials provider, including Prisma schema for User and Account models, database adapter setup in src/lib/auth.ts, and environment variable configuration
Implement authentication API routes (sign-in, sign-up, sign-out) in app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts and app/api/auth/signup/route.ts with password hashing using bcrypt and session management

Create protected route middleware in middleware.ts, authentication context provider in src/contexts/AuthContext.tsx, and user profile management API routes in app/api/user/route.ts with TypeScript types in src/types/auth.ts

ems.task: Implement group management functionality including creating groups, inviting members via email/invite codes, joining groups, and managing member roles. Build the balance calculation engine that tracks who owes whom. Create settlement logic for marking debts as paid

Build expense management features: add expenses with description, amount, payer, and split configuration. Implement equal split logic among group members. Create expense editing and deletion. Build expense history and filtering capabilities

Implement Socket.io server for real-time updates. Create events for new expenses, group changes, member joins/leaves, and settlements. Build presence system for active users. Handle connection/disconnection and room management per group

Build landing page with hero section and feature highlights. Create login and signup pages with forms for both OAuth and email/password. Implement form validation and error handling. Add responsive navigation and footer components

Implement dashboard page showing user's groups with net balance per group, total owed/owing summary, and quick actions to create groups or settle up. Build responsive grid layout for group cards with balance indicators and member avatars

Create group detail page with expense list, member list showing individual balances, add expense form, and settle up functionality. Build expense modal dialog with split configuration. Implement member management (invite/remove). Add activity feed for recent changes

Create reusable shadcn/ui components customized for the app: buttons, cards, dialogs, forms, tables, avatars, badges, and toast notifications. Implement consistent design tokens, color scheme, and typography. Add loading states and skeleton screens

Implement Socket.io client integration for real-time UI updates. Connect to dashboard, group detail pages for live expense/balance changes. Build optimistic UI updates for better perceived performance. Handle connection errors and reconnection logic

analysisSummary: Build a complete expense-sharing application with Next.js 14, featuring Google OAuth/email authentication, group expense management, real-time balance tracking, and Socket.io for live updates. The app will use SQLite for data storage, shadcn/ui for the UI, and implement a clean, mobile-first design.
